channel.title: The Morning After STL
channel.description: The Morning After STL is the longest-running local sports morning show in St. Louis. Tim McKernan, Martin Kilcoyne, Doug Vaughn, and Jackson Burkett have the fortune of hosting the circus each morning from 7 a.m. to 11 a.m. -- LIVE on 101 ESPN Radio at 101.1 FM, https://101ESPN.com, https://TMASTL.com, TMASTL YouTube, The TMASTL app, and anywhere you find podcasts.

item.title: TMA (10-28-24) Hour 1
item.description:
Hey look, everyone, it's Martin Kilcoyne and we're on 101 ESPN now. Bittersweet this morning. There's not another personality around like Iggy Strode. Iggy's rolodex. Jackson has a dossier ready to go.
One segment down and Martin is thinking about quitting. Joey Vitale is up and listening and his nips are hard. The formula for creating a TMA text name. Tough one for Mizzou on Saturday, especially after Brady Cook went down. Drew Pyne may not be the guy. The Tigers laid two eggs against their two biggest opponents. Big miss to not have a backup QB. Luther Burden had 3 catches for 3 yards. Lots of talent back from last season but it just hasn't translated. Our niche is homoerotic sports radio.
Chariman Kurt "met" the love of his life in Tuscaloosa. Met might be the wrong word as he didn't exactly talk to her. She just had an aura about her. Would she have been willing to date an older fella? The Hinge and Bumble scene down in Alabama. Hard to bring a girl back to the Red Roof Inn with your dad in the same room. The needlepoint belts were all over the place. Doug is officiating the Plowhawk's wedding.
Martin has prepared a poem for us. Jackson may or may not have given out the wrong phone number. Not sure who is going to filter the phone calls during this moment of transition. Martin meets Libby Jack.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: TMA (10-28-24) Hour 2
item.description:
The YouTube chat is active this morning. Martin reads some mean tweets about the show changes from over the weekend. We welcome your hatred. Everything goes back to, "It should be good for Timmy."
Our first guest on 101, Chris Kerber, joins us to talk about the Blues' weekend. Chief coming back to St. Louis. Some breaking news coming up on the Tuscaloosa girl in the Tiger striped dress. Does Buck Swope have a real job?
A listener has DM'd a picture of what could be the tiger-striped dress girl. Unfortunately it is not her, but it is Brady Cook's mom. Audio of Drink following the loss in Tuscaloosa. Drink's post-game presser was short and sweet on Saturday.
Audio of Freddie Freeman's historic game-winning grand slam on Friday night. Hell of a call from joe Davis. Audio of Aaron Boone explaining the logic of using Nestor Cortes. Dodgers up 2-0 going into Game 3 tonight in The Bronx. The BYU coach went to Kirkwood High.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: TMA (10-28-24) Hour 3
item.description:
Missouri is where I live. Gabe DeArmond joins us to talk about the disaster in Tuscaloosa. How long will Brady Cook be out with his hand injury? Hope is that it is not season-ending, but the Oklahoma game could be in jeopardy. Hopes of the College Football Playoffs are dead. Will players be opting out with less to play for now? Looking back on the many TMA stops throughout the 20 years. The 590 The Man/1380 The Woman situation. The Late Night Score & Nick and The Badger.
Quite an ending in the Commanders Bears game yesterday. Bone-headed play by the Bears defender. Audio of Mike Francesa and he's not happy with the Jets and their interim coach. Some of our old texters have found their way to the new text line. Doug's fescue situation. Martin's gotta go at 10.
Warfare going on in the two YouTube chats. Hate listeners. Guest hosts when some of the regulars are out. BenFred's article about Nolan Arenado. Will he be back next season? Moves that weren't made in the last couple years.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: TMA (10-28-24) Hour 4
item.description:
Balloon Party is now Hour 4 of TMA. Just know, Jackson is happy. Jackson's got some questions for us. How the 12-Team Playoff will affect expectations within college football programs. Anarchy is on the horizon. Missouri and Illinois hopes are gone but lots of excitement down the stretch in the CFB world. Should Jackson and Tim forget their salaries in exchange for longer segments. Chairman still reeling from missing out on the love of his life. Will Mizzou score again this season if Drew Pyne is the QB?
Mike Elko firing some shots in his postgame comments on Saturday. Who was he talking about? Tim's tongue. Big game Saturday in the Big Ten between Ohio State and Penn State. Outstanding College Gameday in Bloomington. Kirk Hebstreit and Lee Corso.
Doug is getting acclimated to the 10:00 hour. The debut of the Email of the Day segment on 101 coming up. Tim found himself pulling for the Cleveland Browns yesterday. Audio of Jameis Winston channeling his inner Marshall Mathers after the Browns win. Supercut of Gabe's voicemails from the Power Mizzou post-game show. Jackson's not a fan of Harrison's Brother, Master. Jackson's JUICY shorts. Follow us on IG at tma_stl.
E-Mail of the Day

item.title: TMA (10-29-24) Hour 1
item.description:
This Burke guy is kind of a mutt. What's Jackson's hockey nickname? If you can see us as you drive down Olive, give us a wave. Jackson's magic dossier. Martin said down with John Mozeliak for the 2Fox. Piddles is a poor speller. The Whale Tail Phenomenon. WHY IS CHAIM BLOOM HIDING?!?! Pale Whales. Props to Tommy for reducing the commercial breaks. Figuring out the phone liens in this time of transition.
John Kelly joining us at 8:15. Yankees might be in some trouble. Should Aaron Boone sit Aaron Boone? The LaRussa/Rolen beef. Fun with percentages. Ludacris at The Dome. Fat Joe at Yankee Stadium. Fat Joe can't walk. Cardinals had Rascal Flats perform and ProdJoe proclaimed that the Cardinals would never win another World Series. Audio of Fat Joe's performance. VIP Pat is our first caller. Banty on The Fan Page yesterday.
Listeners are streaming while sky-pigging. YouTube chat talking about Mt. Rushmore of fat rappers. Audio of John Sterling getting fooled by a fly ball. Martin sat down with Martin Kilcoyne yesterday. Audio of Mo talking about the rumor of the Cardinals being sold. Is there a succession plan in place for the DeWitts? Bad time to sell. The structure of the Cardinals' front office.

item.description:
A little clock abuse so we're gonna get back on track. Who is your "Pale Whale"? Doug thinks Mike Shildt. John Mozeliak gave Shildt the green light to talk about the firing but we've never heard his side.
Blues play-by-play guy John Kelly joins us on the phone lines from Ottawa. What positives and negatives has he seen in the Blues early on? Injuries has been a problem. Team speed seems to be improved. Reuniting with Craig Berube.
Jackson's random NBA SportsCenter update. Taking calls at the 2Fox asking for scores. Should we get Fernando Vina to call in? Caller Adam has found his way to the 101 phone lines. Adam is angry about no one answering the phones. Globule of lube. Coconut oil at room temperature. Tom Schmitt knows good lube and BBQ. Adam has been potted down. Would Kevin Demoff talk and would you want to talk to him? Speculation of Demoff being a possible NFL commissioner.
Martin wasn't happy with Adam's call. The conspiracy theory around drafting Michael Sam. Tim had Jeff Fisher on his podcast. Doug's Fisher impression is all jowl. Texts coming in on Pale Whale suggestions. Mike Keenan and Frank Cusumano didn't get along real well. Calvin May & The Skipper.

item.description:
Andy Crouppen and his luscious head of hair join us in-studio talking about perjury. How could we get Kroenke and Demoff to tell the truth? Rams trying to buy the spot in Earth City for $1.
Jackson's got "So What'd Your Grandma Think" for us. Jackson needs the drapes drawn. Giving Martin the context with audio of Calvin May asking Jason Heyward what his grandma thought. A reporter questioned Trevon Diggs' effort and Diggs went lookin' for him. Things got a little tense. Audio of Shannon Sharpe defending the reporter on his podcast with Ochocinco. Ochocinco is Jackson's Pale Whale.
Martin was pleased with Jackson's NBA update. Audio of Mozeliak talking with Martin about the fans supporting the Cardinals going forward through some tough times. Cards use of technology. The Minor League pipeline. The Cardinals were wondering in 2014 what they had in Oscar Tavares. The difficulty identifying talent goes back a decade. The Cards' model going forward.
Liaa has a question on the phone lines. Lisa's not happy with Oli's leadership and Doug's not happy with Lisa's language. Strange timing of the Marmol extension. Managers vs. Analytics. Martin very briefly goes into Tony.

item.description:
Doug's concerned we may have to start going to Blues morning skate. Checking in on the text line. Jackson is really battling the sun in this studio. Doug's Jackie O sunglasses. Doug's had enough and he's gonna fix the drapes situation. Jackson's all about the giggles. And in a surprising hot take, Jackson seems down on the premise of Back To The Future. Is Martin cruising around Creve Coeur Park?
Questions 'O' Plenty with Lil Piddles. Fandom in cold weather vs. warm weather cities. Would Jackson rather go to the Blues vs. Leafs or stay home and play video games? Local athletes with wide deltas of fan approval. Matheny was beloved as a player but not so much as manager. Warner & Bulger.
We somehow missed the 13 year anniversary of the David Freese game. Thanks to the listener in the text inbox for letting us know. But that means the Cardinals won the World Series 13 years ago today. Yankees on life support. Uniform nirvana. Human lamb.

Martin would like to know if he has to go to trivia night. There's some hate coming in the text line but we're going through a reset. Blues had a small issue last night in Ottawa.
Tim had a nice conversation with a listener yesterday. Tough one last night in Ottawa. Blues lose 8-1. Audio of a disappointed Drew Bannister after last night's drubbing. You can't chase the game, Tim. Big Walt had to have been happy last night. Encouraging start to the road trip but not as much now. TMA After Dark. Bringing the cuckold and sports communities together. Clock changing soon, quite soon. Jackson wasn't allowed to say, "I don't know."
HUGE win yesterday in EMOTD by Misty Plops. Is Plops a nesting body now? We have a Game 5 in the World Series as the Yankee stave off elimination. Audio of the fans trying to pry the ball from Mookie Betts last night. The brothers aren't welcome back at Yankee Stadium. Are these guys the Yankees Rally Squirrel? Jack Flaherty on the mound tonight for the Dodgers. Reliving the Flaherty/Derrick Goold exchange. When the Hoosier Father/Son tandem attacked the coach in Chicago. Too much Bama runnin' through my veins.
Jackson's opening up the doors to the Fan Page today. Power outage in Ottawa last night and they sure turned the lights out on the Blues. The journey of the Blues trunk. Evanesence stole it but left it in Ottawa.

We're joined by the man who coined the nickname "Lil Piddles," Jamie Rivers. Jamie has an issue with the show already. Is this a playoff team? The Note in Philadelphia before returning home to face Chief. Dental cuckings.
Would Jackson rather watch the Blues or answer the phone lines? We may all get together to watch the game. Team transportation doesn't wait for media. Frank Cusumano steals luggage. Is Jackson too elite to answer the phones? A symphony of Frank drops.
Calling into sports talk radio. Audio from Martin's conversation with John Mozeliak. The path that lead to where the Cardinals are currently. Roleplaying with Tim as the reporter and Martin as Mo. Mo's answers are rather unsatisfying.
Reading rapid fire texts from the text line. Reminiscing the days of randomly calling sorority houses on The Morning Grind. Francesa and Stan Lee.

Jeremy Rutherford joins us for two-part questions following the drubbing in Ottawa last night. Where are the home white sweaters? Country Roads. Adults wearing jerseys. Does Drew Bannister have a presence as coach? Corduroy. Which Blues have sand paper to their game? This year's expectations.
Texters coming after Martin. Those pesky brothers at Yankee Stadium trying to take Mookie Betts glove. The boys were ready to D Up. The Yankees haven't responded to ESPN's request for comment. If the Yankees come back will they be on the ring?
The ESPN voiceover guy had some issues with Jackson's last name. Great job if you can get it. Mr. Lix is down on Charlotte. Filling Martin in on Jackson's boys trip to the mountains. IT's starting to happen, we're starting to win em over. Bobby Magic and The Human Ashtray. Catching Martin up on what he's missed the last 18 years. Going dutch on a bed. The Professor.
More fun with voiceover miscues. Dough Vaughn. Ooooh, the 618 is a lady. Nevermind, they don't like us.

Buck Swope has texted Tim to correct the EMOTD standings. Audio of Desmond Howard talking college football with some strange sound effects in it. Ferrario's ball gag. Jackson's golf swing. Wide Berth Wednesday. Lot of statue talk going around with the Dwayne Wade statue situation. Which St. Louis athletes are statue worthy? Is Pietrangelo worthy of a statue? A Kyle Lohse Skip Schumaker statue would look good. Doug missed the Freese homerun in 2011 for a live shot.

item.title: TMA (10-31-24) Hour 1
item.description:
(Apologies for the first few seconds. Hardware issue.) Doug is dressed like a little conductor today. Sirens going off around 2:45 this morning. The TMA Glossary: The Webster Groves vs. Cottleville War. Tim's keys are going off. Janet is a rising star. Bobcat Nostalgia. It's Listener of the Month SZN. Joe Strauss coined "Pee Pee Talk." Amendment 2. How do the teams benefit? Martin's got a surprise guest at 9:30. Jackson wanted to take in Reteif Goosen.
Two horse race in the October EMOTD contest. Audio of the final out of Dodgers World Series win. Yankees really let one slip away last night. Judge's drop in centerfield reminiscent of Matt Holliday. Polling data on Amendment 2. Why is Martin so against this amendment? Is it morality and religious beliefs working against it? Doug's not much of a gambler. TikTok is not just moms dancing and looking for attention. Get your FYP right.
Martin's getting texts from Cousin John. Some are concerned about the effect on minors. Does our audience skew more liberal or conservative? Jackson doesn't wear a lot of khaki. We make picks.....YOU MAKE MONEY! Martin's read on Jack Flaherty was spot on.

Mike was hanging out at Barstool watching the game. Doug's not convinced that 'dossier' is being used correctly. Reuben Studdard.

What kind of reception does he expect when Craig Berube returns? The Hubbard President seemed a little confused with Doug's conductor hat. Polar Express. Joe Davis & Vin Scully.
Audio of Joe Davis talking about his World Series calls. Announcers preparing calls for big moments. Jack Buck thought he blew the Go Crazy Folks call. Eric in the CWE is on the phone lines. Trying to alienate 101 ESPN and TMA listeners. Just a couple guys flirting with each other.

item.description:
Robert Thomas checking in. Talking about the Blues bouncing back from the 8-1 loss in Ottawa. Disappointing to be injured and not be able to help the team. Reminiscing on the famous road trip that brought the 2019 Stanley Cup winning Blues team together. Getting a better feeling in the room by getting the boys together. Knowing right away that the ankle was injured. Martin not taking any of the blame for the injury even though he jinxed him. How well does he know Daddy Padre? His golf handicap.
We're boring and talk no sports, Tim is arrogant and never gets to the point. You can criticize, just be factually correct. Martin's gonna have periodic surprises. Martin and Jackson exchange DMs. Tim and Doug are feeling a little left out. Gonna set up an alliance with Chairman Kurt. The Fescoe Year. Looking back on the years at the picnic table.

Sketches and bits. Joe Buck. Bag 'o' Bits. Martin's heading down to City Park.

item.title: TMA (11-1-24) Hour 1
item.description:
Martin and Tim have been spending time talking to listeners. General banter leading off the dossier. Don't say "Under Center." This show is like St. Louis City SC. Energizer Park. Wayne Huizenga.

We need to bring the TMA and 101 listeners together at TMA Trivia Night. Ozempic pukes. We've left general banter and entered light vamping. Not surprised by not resigning Lynn and GIbson. Martin's got deferred money in his contract. Will Arenado be back next year?
Chairman Kurt's doing podcast stuff. Favorite college football games of the weekend. Penn State and Ohio State. Jackson was caught caressing himself. Jets and Texans last night. Shout out to Bear Down.

item.title: TMA (11-1-24) Hour 2
item.description:

item.description:
It's time for Jackson's Jelly Roll and Post Malone trivia. The category is US Geography.
Keep an eye on Jeremy Rutherford's stuff about the Blues and Jim Montgomery. Reading between the lines.
We're almost back on track here.

item.title: TMA (11-22-24) Hour 1 - Big Bounce Back Day
item.description:
(00:00-16:34) What's involved in a good ruining? Keith Law. Goin' Huntin'. It's evident that Jackson's gonna have a big day. Where's the money on the Indiana/Ohio State game? We may have been a crossbar in overtime away from something significant last night at Enterprise.
(16:35-33:53) Blues came out hot last night with a goal in 12 seconds, go up 2-1 and then in the last ten seconds, boy howdy. Did the crossbar save Drew Bannister? Sliding doors moment. Binnington makes the final save in the shootout and ties Mike Liut for wins. Will Bannister be the coach still by The Winter Classic? Best excuses to get out of something. Is James Caville an alien? Bounce back dossier. 'Due time.
(33:54-42:48) RIP all the dead grandparents surrounding the old Girls Next Door competitions. Browns get in the win in the snow and we've got some Jameis Winston audio. George Pickens is down on the Browns even after losing to em. Crab legs got Jameis at FSU.
(42:49-56:54) Jeremy Maclin making a run with his Pioneers. McCarron vs. The Battlehawks. Audio of Battlehawks head coach Anthony Becht addressing the situation. The parting of ways "wasn't performance based." Kirkwood vs. Jackson should be a doozie tonight.

item.title: TMA (11-22-24) Hour 2 - Joey Vitale & Drops of the Week
item.description:
(00:00-6:29) Let's take a look back at the week that was with The Drops of the Week. The Tradesman Hole. Monogramed Shawls. Would you pay $10 to watch a high school football game online? Cadet on Cadet crime.
(6:30-20:44) Naughty sweeper pics. Joey Vitale calls in to talk getting his young son into gambling. Joey's wife not necessarily on board with the mustache. Joey says there's no reason to part ways with Drew Bannister. Blues got a little tight as that clock ticked down last night. Shift length. Tim got the invite to the Vitale Christmas Party. Slutty Vixen.
(20:45-37:07) Does Doug have a bachelorette party this weekend? Reece Davis and Joey Galloway arguing on the College Gameday podcast about Indiana sitting their quarterback for the Ohio State game. A take going sideways. Doug's unhappy with the edit and Jackson falls on the sword. Culture killer to sit your QB in the biggest game in program history. Caller Jen is on the phone lines. She may be in on the Martin/Jackson alliance.
(37:08-49:23) Audio of comedian Brian Regan on his Netflix special with a humorous take on sports press conferences. Mike Ditka. Tim and Chairman may have a lady for their alliance.

item.title: TMA (11-22-24) Hour 3 - Pick 6 & Constructive Criticism
item.description:
(00:00-13:04) Time for Pick 6. Rutgers is fancy pants. You ever watch that Meet the Press? You don't have to laugh about it. BYU's a fraud. Mizzou wins by 30 or loses to Hail State. It's a stinky spread. Lean into the stink. Keep an eye on them Gophers.
(13:05-24:20) If you were watching during the break you may have seen Tim and Doug kissing. Good one on line one is unhappy with some of the content of the show. Tim would like to make an official statement on the alleged make out session with Doug. Some are saying this show isn't gay enough.
(24:21-38:26) RIP Bankroll. Drinking scotch and watching Olympic hoops at Mungenast. Audio of Jason Kelce announcing his late night show during the NFL postseason. Guys need dudes. Are you a bro if you wear a tank top? Branch offs of the bro. Watch me take a three pointer, then tell me I'm a sissy.
(38:27-48:16) Favorite television shows from the 90's. Blues going on the road for 7 of their next 8. Audio of Jordan Binnington talking about tying MIke Liut for career wins as a Blue. The revolving door of Blues goalies. Easy, sweet baby.

item.title: TMA (11-22-24) Hour 4 - Gabe DeArmond, TV Trivia, & EMOTD
item.description:

SEC and Big 10 want assurance of 5 spots in playoff. Bryce Underwood flipping to Michigan. Is Brian Kelly in trouble in Baton Rouge?
(16:17-21:48) Doug, you like this return music? Time for Jackson's Jelly Roll and Post Malone trivia. How bout that Mario Lopez?
(21:49-26:03) Friend of Doug Jeff Passan with an article on the Cardinals and their reboot. What level of certainty is there in Helsley being gone? Jackson continuing to beat the John King drum.

item.title: TMA (11-25-24) Hour 1 - Waiting To Chuckle & Jeremy Rutherford
item.description:
(00:00-18:45) We've got a big one today, and Doug's as surprised as anyone. Doug, tell us about scrums. Did you get ruined in Nashville? Jackson's freshly shorn. Five-year deal for JIm Montgomery. Hats off to Tim. Blues saw an opportunity to improve the situation and they took it. Rightsholder radio.
(18:46-30:10) Big wins for Mizzou and Illinois on Saturday. Both squads 8-3. Illini took down Rutgers in an exciting finish. Penn State escaped a near-loss against Minnesota. Teams found out via Twitter that they were going to their conference championship games. Penalizing teams for losing in the conference championship. Drink got a little banty at the end of the Mississippi State game.
(30:11-46:19) Jeremy Rutherford joins us to talk the firing of Drew Bannister and hiring of Jim Montgomery.
(46:20-54:16) Tim's four-game parlay. Audio from down on the plains for the ending of Auburn/Texas A&M in overtime. Layaway on lam-buh. The college football overtime rule is a two-point conversion festival. Staring down the barrel of more chaos in tomorrow's CFP rankings. One loss Indiana's resume.

item.title: TMA (11-25-24) Hour 2 - Chris Kerber & Jim Montgomery Scrum
item.description:
(00:00-10:10) Chris Kerber joins us as he tries to dodge the secondhand smoke in NYC. How surprised was he by the Blues coaching move over the weekend? What's the level of disappointment in the current Blues product?
(10:11-18:24) You don't want Jackson on the witness stand. Bob Wallace will join us tomorrow along with Martin's surprise guest. New coach bump for The Note?
(18:25-34:05) Jim Montgomery's introductory scrum from Madison Square Garden. The dais's reaction.
(34:06-46:55) Jackson may wet himself. Jaxson Dart had himself a nice little cry on Saturday. Audio of the Ole Miss QB talking about the late interceptions. Florida has been a completely different team lately. Florida State free-falling. Who's the best team in College Football right now?

item.title: TMA (11-25-24) Hour 3 - Gabe DeArmond & The Dead Cat Bounce
item.description:
(00:00-20:19) Gabe DeArmond of Power Mizzou joins us to talk about the win in Starkville on Saturday night. Looking ahead to the Arkansas game at Faurot this weekend. Brady Cook's post-Mizzou future. Mizzou's playoff hopes were shot after the loss in Tuscaloosa. The future of conference championship games. A potential Mizzou/Illinois bowl game.
(20:20-31:42) What's the approval rating of the Blues coaching moves from the weekend? Audio of Doug Armstrong talking about his decision. Armstrong wasn't planning on a coaching change until Montgomery became available. Lots of winnable games left on the table. Don't forget about the Dead Cat Bounce. Are the Blues moving to Cape Girardeau?
(31:43-43:10) Results from last week's Pick Six segment. No one on the dais had a losing record. Roll with me, Doug. The Har-Bowl tonight for MNF. Things aren't going well for the New York Football Giants. Audio of Malik Nabers not real pleased after the game. Jackson issues a statement on his misreporting of Brian Daboll's firing. Audio of a reporter asking Baker Mayfield about his Tommy Devito celebration.
(43:11-53:46) Who was happier to be fired: Jim Montgomery in Boston or Jimbo Fisher at Texas A&M with his $70M buy out. Martin's fielding complains at the 2Fox. Rough day for the Commanders kicker from Belleville. Which college football coach will be first to get the short haircut?

item.title: TMA (11-25-24) Hour 4 - Mad Dog vs. Words & EMOTD
item.description:

(08:12-18:33) Feel this funk. Audio of friend of the show, Mike Francesa, comparing Aaron Rodger's injury with his golf game. Mad Dog has a pronunciation issue. Thinkin' about doin' some sprinklin'. Fun with lines for Texas/Texas A&M and Mizzou/Arkansas.
(18:34-25:24) Only three more EMOTDs remaining in November. Jim Montgomery sounds fired up to be coaching the Blues. Audio of the Blues new coach talking about the Blues fans and the city of St. Louis. Jackson's never looked at the lines after a morning skate.

item.title: TMA (11-26-24) Hour 1 - Blue Collar, Cheap Pop
item.description:
(00:00-19:06) New coach bump, boy howdy. There's the humming. SOG, is what I call it. Dan Hurley of the JCC. Schedule the parade, the Blues are back! Different brand of hockey last night and those blue shirts didn't like it. Blue collar, cheap pop. What about the tripod? Audio of Monty laying hosannas on the boys post-game. Take your shirt off.
(19:07-34:27) Who yelled take your shirt off? Katie Woo reports that Cardinals are exploring trades for Nolan Arenado. Arenado moving to first-base? Owed money could be an issue. Nolan doesn't seem to want to be here. How will history remember the Nolan Arenado era? Mr. DeWitt, tear down that wall. Martin's taking his top off.
(34:28-46:04) Chairman's Therapy Line is ringin' off the hook. Audio of Brayden Schenn talking about the win at MSG last night. TLR was hanging out with John Gruden. Gruden asked Tony his top three clutch pitchers in the playoffs.
(46:05-53:10) Jackson is the media watch dog for this program. Audio from Cleveland radio not real happy with Will Howard's antics at the end of the Indiana game. Fun with odds and value for the CFP National Championship.

item.title: TMA (11-26-24) Hour 2 - Bob Wallace & Relocation
item.description:
(00:00-14:46) Interim Head of Explore St. Louis, Bob Wallace, in-studio. Talking The Dome and Rams relocation.
(14:47-28:17) Talking with Bob Wallace about the St. Louis Football Cardinals relocation. Playing audio from Gene McNary talking about building a stadium in St. Louis County and the ramifications on his political career and audio of Vince Schoemehl's rebuttal. Asking Bob who was telling the truth. What lead up to the Cardinals leaving St. Louis?
(28:18-48:26) When did Bob notice the Rams relocation start to pick up momentum? No one was complaining about the dome when the team was good and the place was filled. Dealing with the city/county divide. How many billionaires we got in this area?
(48:27-51:38) Breaking down what Bob Wallace had to say.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: TMA (11-26-24) Hour 3 - The Interrogator
item.description:
(00:00-9:19) Big night at Madison Square Garden. Audio of Jim Montgomery talking about the Blues tradition in St. Louis and the relationship with alumni. Seems like a good fit. Montgomery's style of positivity. When you set the bar low, you usually get there. Jackson's ready to scrap. Dylan Holloway was the shirt off guy.
(9:20-22:43) Hey, Doug, it's Andy Crouppen. The NFL likes when you sue em a couple three times. Fixing St. Louis's problems start with acknowledging St. Louis's problems. KMOX? Never heard of her. The sibling rivalry between the city and the county.
(22:44-43:36) It's time for Martin's surprise guest. Jackson may have ruined the surprise with a tweet. The Governor Steve Kline joins us. Enjoying life as a college coach. The cradle of coaches. Missing the stag bars. Has one of his players ever flipped him the bird? Banned from Cardinals Fantasy Camp. The Interrogator.
(43:37-46:58) Fun night in NYC last night. Hoping that'll give the boys a little momentum going forward.

item.title: TMA (11-26-24) Hour 4 - John Kelly & EMOTD
item.description:

JK's observations on the moves Doug Armstrong has made over the last few days. Montgomery the right coach at the right time for connecting with young players. How long can this new coach bump last?
(13:29-23:20) Jackson's been waiting on this topic for a few hours now. Takes on Danny Hurley gettin' T'd up in OT in the loss to Memphis. How do you get so angry in a guayabera shirt? Chairman used to get run out of SLABA games.
(23:21-28:28) I need a 30. We want more sports and less sports simultaneously. The plight of drops on 101.

item.title: TMA (11-27-24) Hour 1 - A Little Bridge With My Face
item.description:

Fun with the MSHSAA map. Relationship Jack. Getting hate for staying in St. Louis. Manual stimulation night at the Ballpark. TLR's Goldberg t-shirt. Skanksgiving Depression.
(24:31-36:21) Doug, what's the lede? The Dodgers can't stop signing big contracts. They's on scholarship too. Except the Pirates, they've got some walk-ons. Win the press conference, not the offseason. The Yankees and Red Sox arms race in the early 2000's. Winning the '06 and '11 World Series solidified a mindset with the Cardinals.
(36:22-49:49) New College Football Playoffs rankings are out. Chairman's search for tiger-striped dress is dead. There's a chance the Big XII could be left out. The committee focusing more on the wins than the losses. Three loss South Carolina can make a jump if they beat Clemson. It's running up the score SZN. No motivation to schedule quality non-conference opponents.
(49:50-51:23) Hoping Jackson waking up Robert Thomas isn't an issue. May wanna bet New Jersey.

item.title: TMA (11-27-24) Hour 2 - Robert Thomas & Jamie Rivers
item.description:
(00:00-15:18) Robert Thomas joins us and he doesn't sound real thrilled with Jackson's early text. Not easy losing Drew Bannister but excited about getting a coach like Jim Montgomery. Young players trying to live up to the hype. Addressing the "Take Your Shirt Off" comment after the win on Monday. Can media call players by their nickname?
(15:19-34:12) Jackson's feeling absolved from any Robert Thomas guilt. We're huge in Puerto Rico. Shoresy. Maybe it was a horned up boy. Chaser's Shouldys. We're gonna do Rivers now! Hi, Jamie. Talkin' new coach bump.
(34:13-46:48) Jackson was presented with an award during the break. Take your shirt off, Jack. JB gives an acceptance speech and it's moving. Remember Trung Canidate? Audio of Ken Rosenthal talking Cardinals moving Nolan Arenado. 2025: We're Sitting This One Out. Who's more likely to be at this Spring Training, Nolan Arenado or this show? A hug takes place and a GIF has been made.
(46:49-1:01:58) Jackson's St. Louis Starter Packs Skanksgiving post is choice. Rainbow showers. Is Skanksgiving amateur hour? Weekday day-drinking. Martin is trying to recruit The Chairman to his alliance but Tim is his one and only. Jackson respects verticality. South County specials.

item.description:

(16:59-26:36) The Dodgers assembling themselves a nice little all-star team. Sonny Gray, now we're talking. Jackson declares you can't win a World Series on paper. Would the Dodgers be interested in Nolan Arenado? Red Sox keep coming up in regards to Arenado.
(26:37-35:59) Looking like Cook and Burden's last games on Saturday. Audio of Brady Cook talking about his legacy at Mizzou. Where does the 2023 team rank all-time at Mizzou? What might have been with Jayden Daniels in a Tiger uniform. Is Doug Tiger Nationalizing?

Can a dead cat really bounce? Beautiful Newark, New Jersey. JR dunkin' on STL. News and notes for tonight's game in Jersey.

item.title: TMA (12-2-24) Hour 1 - It's Not Romantic, It's Erotic
item.description:
(00:00-19:04) Festive Banter. Audio Galore. Gus Johnson had a rough go of it on Saturday. Planted flags 'o' plenty. Are you pro or anti flag planting? Ohio State Jack Sawyer wasn't about to let that flag get planted. Ryan Day feelin' the heat in Columbus. Furnace Face. Dan calls in unhappy with Jackson's Thanksgiving programming. You hurt him with that one, Pale.
(19:05-33:36) One at-large spot out there for the CFP. Jackson doesn't wanna talk about his lock of the week. Texas A&M blowin' up parlays. It's not romantic, it's erotic. Rolled 'em at Willie B. Coaches are running up the score all over the place. James Franklin and the Maryland coach got into it about scoring late in the blowout. The Audio Ranking Committeee is confusing. Barry Odom and the Runnin' Rebels.
(33:37-43:02) Tears at Enterprise Center. Binnington with some big saves on Saturday. 5 of 6 points since Montgomery took over. Audio of Binnington talking about the all-time wins record as a Blues goalie. Thomas got the Burkett Bump in New Jersey. It's about Bob. Wins Per Game. Did we just stumble into the perfect system?
(43:03-54:56) Chaser in the booth on Saturday. The Battle Line Rivalry. Brady Cook takes his final touch as a Tiger to the house to win it for Mizzou. Love Howard Richards. Audio of Drink talking about the "rivalry." Pittman just coaching in darkness from the press box. Would Mizzou be in the conversation had they beaten South Carolina? Impressive wins vs. losses. Conflicting messages from the committee.

item.description:

Wide delta for Clemson pending what they do in the ACC Championship. Takesmith's Delight on Thanksgiving with the Bears clock management. Jackson wants a Madden playing teenager as a clock management coach. College programs naming GMs.

item.title: TMA (12-2-24) Hour 3 - Gabe DeArmond & Uniform Jack
item.description:
(00:00-32:03) Gabe DeArmond of Power Mizzou joins us to talk about the Tigers wrapping up the regular season. Tigers post season hopes were dashed after the loss at Alabama. Good ending to Brady Cook's Mizzou career. Looking back on the disappointing offense throughout the year. Reasons to be optimistic after a 9-3 season even though no playoffs is disappointing. Brady Cook's comment on the negative culture in the program. Barry Odom's guy vs. Eli Drinkwitz's guys. Cook won't be getting a waiver for another year. Looking at possible bowl games. Who's Gabe's pick to win the CFP?
(32:04-38:21) The possibility of Mizzou and Colorado meeting in The Vegas Bowl. Audio of Deion Sanders talking about his seniors intending to play in the bowl game. It would be a game changer if everyone collectively bought into these bowl games. Doug's a BIG fan of Ralphie The Buffalo.
(38:22-52:01 ) How'd you like that SportsCenter update. Tim's unintentional spit take. Arch Madness. Taking people's temperature on the NBA talk. Pro Squash updates. Uniform Jack on Twitter. Swiming in a t-shirt. Supple man breasts. Band aids floating in the pool. Who's the guy moaning in the background? The infamous yellow diaper.
(52:02-59:42) Jackson's weekend wrap-up. Which sport has the best fighting? Baseball fights. Running down from the bullpen. Is Jackson down on UFC? No more talkey for Jackie.

item.description:

(15:34-19:25) All Lainey Wilson, all the time. YouTube premium.
(19:26-26:35) Just gettin' ourselves situated over here. Who is one player the Cardinals have traded or released in the last four years you would like to have back? Alright, fine, last five years. Let's just go back to Joy Behar. Brief airing of grievances. Pillows for road trips.

The Miami mascot, Sebastian, spittin' game at a Syracuse reporter. Mrs. Red can get it. A nose for news. Sweatiest coaches. Attracted to all three in different ways. Non plus on WPG's jerseys.

item.title: TMA (12-4-24) Hour 1 - Get Off Your High Horse
item.description:
(00:00-15:39) Boy Howdy, do we have a great one lined up for you today, Doug. Did Ruthsy pass on the Winnipeg trip? This show needs a decoder ring. Maybe I did, we talk a lot. Jackson on the lookout for Siamese Twins. Jordan Kyrou, how do you do? 7 of 8 points with Monty. Can we make Doug Armstrong weep? Big night for the fighting Tigers. Banners are forever. Vacationing in Hampton Village. A very Heteronormative Doug.
(15:40-34:23) Jackson's trying to slither away. Volume of engagement, Doug. Ward Manuel on the latest CFP rankings. Did Sebastian cost Miami a spot with his filthy behavior? Alabama gets the spot over Ole Miss. Which of the teams can make a run and win it all? The three-loss SEC teams are locked in place. Is Charlie Marlowe reeling?

item.description:
(00:00-18:19) Bernie Federko joins the show talking about the Blues losing a tough one in Edmonton last night. Missed opportunity for at least one point last night. The team's psyche after dropping two in a row. Parayko and Holloway's injury situations. The final push for the playoffs.
(18:27-55:22) Doug is Danish shaming this morning. Jackson snuck in some NBA grooming. Nuggets firing Michael Malone right before the playoffs. Doug's taking a private jet to Southern California. The Athletic talking the Blues reason for hope in the playoffs. Best record in the league since February 1st. Holloway's injury is cause for concern. They want us to talk ladies of the night in Jamaica. It's almost playoff time when Binnington is losing his mind. Martin wants to hear from the people. Pestus is first. Keith is next. John in the three hole. Martin's Dangly Bits in the cleanup spot.
(55:32-1:08:51) Serenade me, Dad. Testing Tim's memory of Masters winners. So impressive. Martin's filing a protest.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: TMA (4-10-25) Hour 3 - Justice for Jackson
item.description:
(00:00-14:26) Bryson Stott. Cardinals walk-up songs. Colby Rasmus and Boy Foy. Doug is steadfast on not liking the NHL EBUG rule. Most electrifying clips in modern baseball. We don't give two people enough credit: Lance Berkman and Kyle Lohse. Cotton candy. Josh the Bat Boy.
(14:35-22:42) Bottle service at My House. Audio of Brandel Chamblee on Fore Play talking about broadcasting at Augusta. Don't say Back 9. Height of elitism nonsense. Is Boston Market still a thing? Don't even think about taking your phone out.
(22:52-28:05) Ozzie Guillen says doing sports talk radio is harder than managing a Major League Baseball team. Fighting at TGI Fridays. Tim's cadet gloves.

item.title: TMA (4-10-25) Hour 4 - Feel Good About Humanity & Your Lips & EMOTD
item.description:
(00:00-8:20) Ryan Ludwick and Brass Monkey. Snugglers vs. Love Seats. The Big House in Ann Arbor. Robert Thomas and Jordan Kyrou talking about finishing the last two games on a strong note. Jackson loves that playoff hockey.
(8:28-9:41) Quick leaderboard update from Augusta. Scottie lurking early.
(9:51-20:19) Doug really wants to give The Real Housewives of TMA a shot. Jackson thinks What-A-Burger is overrated. E-Mail of the Day.
